messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Chuck Peck <chuck091956@y...>
wrote:
> What I thought would help in a new QS font most, would
> be better "kerning" and letter shape. Between the two
> of them I think we could get a font that would connect
> well and look good.

Just because it looks like fun to me, I'm probably going to code the
Layout properties I think a QS font should have. The end result is
a file that I can use to turn practically any existing TrueType QS
font into an OpenType font that intelligently produces Senior QS.

FYI. No expected delivery date; might be vaporware.

I'd contribute on the kerning, but that would require actually
drawing or modifying glyphs, which I'm disinclined to do (I can't
find a glyph-editing tool that I both like and can afford).

(For example, I tried just adding kerning to Jerome.ttf, and I found
that s and t -- the first one I tried -- just won't line up, the
angles of the strokes are too different, and I don't have any tools
to "bulk them up."
